Orientation Session at the apartment of Miss Marguerite Fleming.
Welcome by Superintendent Hickey. Brief remarks by Dr. Harry
Skornia, Executive Director, NAEB; Frank E. Schooley, Treasurer,
NAEB; and by staff members. Featured address by Dr. Harold
Hand.
Miss Gertrude McCance, speaking on Educational Broadcasting in

Miss McCance, leading discussion on Why We Write and What We
Write.
Self-introduction by staff and members of Seminar.
Visit to the Goldenrod, last showboat on the Mississippi.
-Mrs. Helen Stanley, speaking on The Writer*s Organization of
Materials; Preparation for Scriptwriting; the Pre-Writing
Period.
• Guest Speaker: Miss Esther Aschmeyer, “How a Radio Planning
Committee works with the station on Social Studies Programs.“
■ Miss Betty Girling, speaking on Organizing a Series.
Guest Speaker: Dr. John Whitney, "How a Planning Committee
Helps with Science Programs."
Experiences of members of the Seminar in organizing various se¬
ries which had proved particularly successful. Playing of ex¬
cerpts from these series.
Auditioning and discussing three taped programs: Music in the
Making, It*s Fun to Draw, and People and Places.
-Visit studios of Station KETC-TV; tour of TV facilities; address
by Mr. Richard Goggin, Manager of KETC.
Division into three groups:
Miss Girling: Basic Fundamentals of Radio Writing

Burlap Bags
